intro: Pilosella brachiata subsp. pieniakensis, commonly known as the Pieniakens pilosella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features slender, branched stems covered with fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
